thread.title: Meet the Mets stars in these Amazin’ yearbook photos
thread.title_full: Meet the Mets stars in these Amazin’ yearbook photos | New York Post

author: David K. Li
title: Meet the Mets stars in these Amazin’ yearbook photos
text:
Modal Trigger Meet the Mets stars in these Amazin' yearbook photos Posted: October 20, 2015 View Thumbnails Previous Next Advertisement Noah Syndergaard Right: Charles Wenzelberg
Steven Matz Left: Victor Alcorn; right: Paul J Bereswill 
Matt Harvey Left: Douglas Healey; right: Paul J Bereswill
Jacob deGromm Right: AP

Emma, Dakota and Miranda pucker up their pink pouts 8 Photos Emma Roberts, Dakota Johnson and Miranda Kerr are among the stars sporting pretty pink pouts this fall. The day in photos 20 Photos The Northern Lights illuminate England, a baby gorilla makes an adorable debut and more. J.Lo and Jessica Alba flaunt fall’s biggest beauty trends 12 Photos The day in photos 17 Photos A turtle finds a new home, Donald Trump continues courting delegates, autumn leaves decorate Paris and more. Thumbnails Captions OFF Share Share this: Facebook Twitter Google Whatsapp Email More Galleries Today, they’re the New York Mets aces who rule the mound at Citi Field.
But just a few years ago, Noah Syndergaard, Jacob deGrom, Matt Harvey and Steven Matz were pipsqueak kids, unrecognizable as the major-league studs now racing toward the World Series.
The most startling transformation is that of Syndergaard, who was an awkward, doughy kid in a middle-school photo taken around 2005.
“Back in eighth grade, I was a chunkster,” Syndergaard recalled in a 2012 interview. “Kids would tease me for being overweight.”
One day, he told his father he wanted to join the YMCA and eat healthy — beginning his amazing transformation into a 6-foot-6 star athlete who graduated in 2010 from Mansfield Legacy HS in Mansfield, Texas.
DeGrom, too, is hardly recognizable in a 2007 high-school yearbook picture from Calvary Christian Academy in Ormond Beach, Fla.
Matz, an alum of Ward Melville HS in East Setauket, LI, bears the closest resemblance to his early self.
Meanwhile, Harvey, nicknamed the Dark Knight, tried to pull off a smoldering tough-guy look in his 10th-grade yearbook photo from Fitch Senior HS in Groton, Conn.
